episodes.title: Rise of Cult Gangs in Nigeria: Deaths and Violence Surge in South-South, South-West
episodes.description:
The violent rise of cult gangs in Nigeria’s South-South and South-West regions has reached alarming levels. Once confined to university rivalries, these gangs—Black Axe, Eiye, Vikings, and others—have now become widespread criminal networks. Between 2020 and 2025, over 1,600 deaths have been attributed to their activities, making them a significant threat akin to terrorism and banditry. From political manipulation to turf wars over illegal activities like oil bunkering, these gangs have turned urban spaces into dangerous war zones. We hear from security experts and youth-focused organisations to discuss how the crisis escalated and potential solutions. Joining us are Kehinde Giwa, Security Analyst at SBM Intelligence, and Opeoluwa Taiwo, Executive Director at the Africa Bridge Initiative.

episodes.title: 19 Feared Dead in Cult Clash in Rivers State  - 9 AM News 10 February, 2025
episodes.description:
In Rivers State, at least 19 people are feared dead following a renewed cult clash in the Obelle Community, Emohua Local Government Area. The violence erupted between the Deybam and Icelanders cult groups, forcing residents to flee for safety. This incident follows a deadly attack last Wednesday, where seven people were killed by suspected cultists.
The clash on Sunday reportedly began as retaliation, with both groups fighting for control. Police spokesperson Grace Iringe-Koko confirmed that 10 deaths have been reported, and an investigation is underway. Residents are urgently calling for government intervention to restore peace.

episodes.title: Kenyan Cult Leader Goes on Trial for Terrorism Charges Over Followers' Deaths
episodes.description:
In East Africa, the leader of a Kenyan doomsday cult, Paul Nthenge Mackenzie, is on trial for terrorism charges related to the deaths of over 400 of his followers. The macabre case has shocked the world. Mackenzie appeared in court in Mombasa along with 94 co-defendants. Journalists were removed from the courtroom shortly after the hearing began to enable a protected witness to testify. Stay tuned for updates and detailed coverage of this significant trial.
